6.Bd3 is more popular, but I prefer to play 6.Qc2 first, which forces black to come up with a useful move, since now 6...dxc4 7.Bxc4 and white gains a tempo on the usual line, as the bishop has only moved once to recapture on c4.

I was expecting 23...Bg5 24.Nxg5 Qxg5 25.f4 Qe7, with a plus to white because of the space advantage.  Note that 23...Bxa2? simply loses the B to 24.b3. This bishop really should stay on the c8-h3 diagonal.
